unique_comments.author: ChilledParadox
unique_comments.text:
I agree with most of what you have said. 

It is embarrassing and shameful that the country where I live and was born treats its citizens like second class. It‚Äôs frankly disappointing to the highest degree that my government actively works against the best interests of the majority of its citizens. Frankly I could go on and on and on and on about this because the politics in the US right now are threatening my livelihood (I have multiple preexisting diseases, mental health issues under treatment, and am on welfare), depending on how things go here the next 4 years there‚Äôs a real chance I just die. 

So yeah I‚Äôm in agreement with most of what you have said, you‚Äôre right, it should be better, the government should be protecting its citizens. 

But the facts are that it doesn‚Äôt and it won‚Äôt. We have an anti-vaxxer who mutilates dead whales to drive their carcass home and had worms eating his brain leading our national health department. Our director of national intelligence is a known Russian asset. Our president is a known Russian asset. Our department of defence leader is an alcoholic who worked in a propaganda fake news show. Our other departments are being cut and defunded by a South African ketamine fiend and his band of 20 year old racist gamers. 

We don‚Äôt have the best or the right people on the job and people are so blind to what‚Äôs happening it‚Äôs completely absurd to think that anything positive will happen for workers, union or non-union, from our government. 

So the only choice left for these Va‚Äôs to defend their rights and salaries and lives is to back the union. And on that, SAGAFTRA is also not a normal union. That‚Äôs part of why its fees are so high in comparison to other unions in the US as well. They are a guild. Guilds by design are intended and meant to be monopolies. The flip side is they have even more bargaining power as a result. If they start fucking over the actors that are a part of the guild those actors would not pay the fees and join and the guild would fall apart. That it is still around is a sign that it‚Äôs members view the benefits from joining it favorably. 

So again, I agree with pretty much everything you‚Äôre saying, idealistically. But life down here isn‚Äôt ideal, so we‚Äôre left to do what we can with the pieces that remain.

unique_comments.author: mangosail
unique_comments.text:
No, there‚Äôs something more going on here than you‚Äôre giving credit to. Your comment on running is historically correct. Look at the chart from last year. That wasn‚Äôt an outlier. That‚Äôs how it is every year. The best offenses pass and the worst ones run. It‚Äôs like clockwork. And suddenly this year something really weird and different is happening. 

If you want to say the league has never seen a combo like Lamar and Henry, that‚Äôs fair. But the Packers absolutely do not have some outlier talent. They‚Äôre a good team! But they‚Äôre not historically good. Not only is their OL only pretty good, it‚Äôs nowhere near where it has been at other points in Lafleur‚Äôs tenure. Another way to point this out, if you just go position by position, you probably prefer every single player on the Eagles offense over every player on the Packers‚Äô offense (and probably over the Saints as well). Same with the Lions - they‚Äôre probably more talented than the Packers and Saints at every position. But we‚Äôre not seeing these ridiculous outlier performances when the Eagles and Lions are healthy. We‚Äôve *never* seen these ridiculous outlier performances before. 

These teams are running the ball an amount that we‚Äôd consider *stupid* in the past few years, but they‚Äôre incredibly efficient and they‚Äôre even generating explosives like more traditional passing offenses do. That‚Äôs really weird! Not everyone can have Lamar Jackson, but the Packers have like a borderline top-8 OL and have 13 total QB runs on the year. You‚Äôre asking ‚Äúwhat‚Äôs next here?‚Äù and my guess is that it‚Äôs whatever is happening in Green Bay and New Orleans. Green Bay in particular seems very odd. Will they have even a single 2nd team all pro player on offense this year? They have no uniquely talented players, they‚Äôre running the ball the 4th most vs. expectation, and they‚Äôre [leading the league in explosives](https://packerswire.usatoday.com/2024/10/01/packers-lead-nfl-in-explosive-plays-through-4-weeks-in-2024/#). That‚Äôs not how it is supposed to work! The passing offenses are supposed to generate the explosives. Their leading receiver in snap share is mf Romeo Doubs! There is something happening here that is going under-discussed.

unique_comments.author: Sunlight72

I‚Äôm old.

Knowing now the pain and confusion of 30 years blindly guessing how to find my fit in a career, under $10,000 for targeted one-on-one career investigation and counseling is an incredible, incredible deal for someone who doesn‚Äôt know what they‚Äôre doing or where or how to look for a direction.

In my own life my lack of ability to assess who I am and what my choices are has cost me 2 divorces, a broken engagement, and 30 years of at-best marginal financial stability. 

If I could turn back the clock, that $5885 could have yielded an increase monetary value of (?) $2 million, and a family.

If I were able to listen and apply the findings.

I‚Äôm just saying, for some of us it would be a good value investment.

unique_comments.author: BeareaverOP
unique_comments.text:
Well, on mid is bad, simply bad. Idk what rito did.
I main Zoe, and she is not the best at farming. Imagine, 2-3 seasons ago, i olayed against malzahars, left and right, up and down. And malza has extremely good wave clear so that means it's hard for me to counter, i have to position extremely well, preclear casters, kill his spawns, 2 times and get his shield down, after which i maybe have 3-5 seconds to harrass him and that is pre 6. Before the minion update, this used to be a bit easier, i could just freeze better in lane, and use that frozen wave to harass him. Now, he just insta kills a wave in 2 abilities, i can barely keep up pre 6, and post 6 is awfull. I mean, if i can play impecable mechanically, i can kill him pre 6, but guess what the worst part is. It's the fact that his minnions, which i couldn't kill at least half, deal a fk ton  of dmg. So just from minions in a single fight i get half hp'd so i am forced to back. So no time to fast push after i kill him, cuz he just insta clears the next wave and by the time i arive on lane, he is shoving into my turret.
 
No, i don't play TP, i play Barrier, it's more utilitarian, and i don't use ignite cuz i need a target for it. So if i try to run, that extra burst of ms from activating barrier is far better than just inting.
 
A benefit, since i can also kill minions faster post 5, i usually kill laner, fast push, take plate, back, roam a lane, and by the time the laner is back, the third wave normalises in the middle and i get to get 1-2 more kills or assists on another lane. By the time i reach mid, his third and second wave are left in maybe 4-5 minions under my turret, so i lost a wave +-2 minions, but i just burst the shit out of the enemy, send him to the goulag or at least close to it, so i can recover. But these scenarios are rare, and i have to make the perfect play and decision and an exact point in time, else i lose way too much exp and gold which would've kept me ahead and would've pushed me further.
